body_html:
@avanish Have you figured out the issue? I found nsync_cv.h in the python site packages folder.
On my Mac it is in ~/anaconda2/envs/tensorflow/lib/python2.7/site-packages/external/nsync/public, since I'm using Anaconda for python. Just add this folder to your include path and it should fix the issue.
body_text:
@avanish Have you figured out the issue? I found nsync_cv.h in the python site packages folder.
On my Mac it is in ~/anaconda2/envs/tensorflow/lib/python2.7/site-packages/external/nsync/public, since I'm using Anaconda for python. Just add this folder to your include path and it should fix the issue.
body:
@avanish Have you figured out the issue? I found `nsync_cv.h` in the python site packages folder.
On my Mac it is in `~/anaconda2/envs/tensorflow/lib/python2.7/site-packages/external/nsync/public`, since I'm using Anaconda for python. Just add this folder to your include path and it should fix the issue.
